intro: Fibigia spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf fibigia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Fibigia spathulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or near water bodies. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
